venue.name: Mt. Monadnock: Old Halfway House Trailhead

item.description:
That’s right, the EDT has come to an end and the EST has begun... and we all know what that means... 4:30 sunsets... early darkness blanketing the land.. cold descending in from the north... warmth retreating to the south. Snow. Sleet. Ice. Winter. Brrrrrrrrrrr. But should we let that stop us? NO!!!! On the very day that the EDT becomes the EST, I mean to walk into the woods, climb another mountain, let out a barbaric yawp to fill the valleys, and absorb what lingering rays of daylight savings time light there may be left. EDT… Rest In Peace. 


With that said... this is what I have in mind: Mt Monadnock; the Old Toll Road entrance; a Southside/Westside hike.

We'll take the Halfway House, Cart Path, Mossy Brook, Marian, Marlboro & Dublin trails to the summit & the Smith Summit, Amphitheater, Smith Connecting, Bald Rock, Cliff Walk, Hello Rock & Halfway House back to the cars (map). And let's not forget Colonel Mustard, w/ the Candlestick, in the Study. 

In short, this will be a Sunday hike filled w/ much variety, a schmorgesborg of gentle graded trails, steep strenuous rock climbs, summit views, steep strenuous rock descents, not-so-steep not-so-strenuous rolling descents (w/ open ledge views) and some more gentle graded trails. It’s one big lollipop loop, sweet & smooth on the outside and hard & crunchy on the inside. And if all that you know of Monadnock are the White Dot & White Cross, then at the very least, get ready for something a bit different.


Also, be prepared for changes of temperature and strong winds on the summit. Dress in layers and have a wind/rain jacket. Bring plenty of insulation, water, food, and something warm to drink. We will hike at a steady moderate pace. Severe weather cancels this event. Pets are not permitted (park rules).

PS. Should there be snow or ice on the summit, microspikes or other additional traction devices will be needed. [I will call the park Thursday to get that question answered.]


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cold Weather/Fall Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes (preferably waterproof)
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• MICROspikes, STABLicers, ect... (a must when there's snow or ice on the trail)


the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant/Toiletries
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

Important:
NO JEANS, NO SNEAKERS, NO COTTON CLOTHING (They get wet, They stay wet & They won’t keep you warm). ALSO, LET'S NOT UNDERESTIMATE ANYTHING, so come prepared for the worst: cold cold temps., wet weather, early darkness and lots of wind.

 

Directions:
Find your way to Jaffrey, NH. Follow Rt 124 west past Dublin Rd. (& the main entrance to Monadnock St Park), continue for approx. 3 miles (5 min) until you reach the Old Toll Rd/Halfway House park entrance. Turn right. Pay. Park. Hike. (Park Entrance Fee: $4 per person)

From Providence: 2 hours
From Newport: 2 hours 30 minutes

Google Maps:
http://maps.google.com/maps?...

(Lat.=42.83529, Lon.=-72.113844)


Additional Information:

Mount Monadnock: 3165 feet

Distance: approx. 5-6 miles
Elevation Gain (total): approx. 1800 ft
Exposure: Full @ the summit

Difficulty: Moderate/Strenuous
Pace: Moderate
Approx. Hike Time (including stops): 6:00+ hrs

Sunrise: 6:28 a.m.
Sunset: 4:36 p.m.

Approx. Temp. Hi: mid 40’s
Approx. Temp. Lo: mid 30’s

10-Day Weather Outlook:
http://www.weather.com/weather/tenday/USNH0116

Current Trail Conditions:
http://monadnocktrails.com/weather.trails.php



Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From Jaffrey, follow Rt 124 west for approx. 5 miles (pass Dublin Rd, the park's main entrance), turn right @ the Old Toll Road park entrance; look for a grey Jetta w/ CT plates; cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Mt. Monadnock & the EDT R.I.P.
